title: A watch was sold at a profit of 15%. If its cost had been 5% less and it had been sold for Rs. 21 less, then the profit would have been 10%. What is the cost price of the watch? - Quora

response.answer_text: _...An Algebraic method- Cost price of the watch Rs.x selling price = 115x/100 If CP is 5% less, New CP = 95x/100 New SP=(115x-2100)/100 profit = Sp-cp Profit = (115x-2100) 100-95x/100 = (20 x-2100)/100 % of profit = 10 Profit %=profit/c.p. x100 10={(20x-2100) /100/95x/100}x100 (20x-2100) 100/95=10 (20 x-2100,) 100 = 950x 2000x-2l0000=950x 1050x=210000 x=2loooo/1050 = 200 Costprice x = Rs 200

Answer is Rs. 200. Let (C1, S1) & (C2, S2) denote respectively original & reduced (cost-price, sell-price) of the given watch. According to given data we have, S1 = C1*(1 + 0.15) = 1.15*C1 …… (1) C2 = C1*(1 - 0.05) = 0.95*C1 …… (2) S2 = S1 - 21 …… (3) S2 = C2*(1 + 0.10) = 1.10*C2 …… (4) Using (1), (2) & (3) we get from (4) as follows, S1 - 21 = 1.10*C2 or 1.15*C1 - 21 = 1.10*(0.95*C1) or (1.15 - 1.045)*C1 = 21 or C1 = 21/0.105 = 200 (Rs.)
